adverb.description: At some distance in the direction indicated; over there.
examples: there's a ford south of here, about nine miles yonder

determiner.description: That or those (used to refer to something situated at a distance)
examples: what light through yonder window breaks?
attempting to fly off into the wild blue yonder

origin: Middle English: of Germanic origin; related to Dutch ginder over there, also to yon.
